description: Battlefield Studios has announced a free trial for Battlefield 6, taking place over the Thanksgiving break for people in the US. The free trial runs November 25 through December 2, and it'll feature a sampling of the full game, including five modes and three maps (these were not specified, however). The free trial will be available across all platforms: PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC. Battlefield 6 free trial start-times The free trail begins November 25 at 4 AM PT / 7 AM ET. It ends at the same time on December 2. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Blackpink's Lisa is Fortnite Festival's Next Season Headliner
description: After a relatively brief season that had no big star leading the show, Fortnite Festival is returning to normal for Chapter 7. The next headlining artist for Harmonix's rhythm game will be Lisa, the singer/rapper/dancer/actor best known as a member of Blackpink. Lisa will have a skin and jam track on the new Starlux music pass, and she'll also have a set of cosmetics in the item shop for the duration of the season, which begins November 29. The Starlux music pass launches on November 29 alongside the start of Fortnite Chapter 7. The music pass, which is progressed by gaining XP in any Fortnite mode just like the battle pass, includes the Fortnite-original Melodie Mars skin at the start of the pass, and the Rockstar Lisa skin (pictured below) at the end of it. In between, you'll be able to unlock plenty of cosmetics, including instruments, and up to eight jam tracks, including four licensed ones: Get Jiggy by B Jack$, Zeddy Will Dashstar* VIP by Knock2 Sorry by Justin Bieber F*** Up the World (Vixi Solo Version) by Lisa Lisa will also have a bundle of cosmetics in the item shop for the duration of the season, as well as jam tracks for Rockstar and New Woman. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Bethesda Dev Wants More Shadowdrops Because "We All Have Short Attention Spans Now"
description: Bethesda did a shadowdrop for The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered earlier this year, and it was a big success. Another Bethesda-published game, Hi-Fi Rush, had a shadowdrop as well. Now, Bethesda Game Studios director Tom Mustaine is openly calling for more releases of this type in the future from other developers across the industry. Speaking to GamesRadar, Mustaine said the shadowdrop approach is a favorite of Bethesda boss Todd Howard, and releasing games like this can be a way to reach players who may have short attention spans. "We all have short attention spans now," he said. "There's Grand Theft Auto, for example. I want that today, right? So it is an interesting strategy ... I don't have any ideas of what would be next, but I hope it's not the last. Personally, I think it was great to own the internet for that day and, you know, give people exactly what they want the moment we talk about it. I'm a fan of that personally, but I'd love to see more people do it." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Expedition 33 Star Reacts To TGA Nomination, Says He Doesn't Deserve All The Credit
description: Actor Charlie Cox was nominated for Best Performance at this year's Game Awards for his role as Gustave in the breakout hit Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. He's now reacted to receiving that nomination, saying he is thrilled, but also making it clear that the credit ought to go to the performance-capture actor, Maxence Cazorla. "I am thrilled for this nomination," Cox said at the La Conve/Animex event in Mexico recently. "There is an amazing French actor by the name of Maxence Cazorla who did almost all of the motion capture for that role in that game. Any nomination, or any credit I get, I have to give to him. I believe the performance of that character is really down to him and my voice was just a part of that process." Charlie talking about his nomination at #TheGameAwards pic.twitter.com/hfWkH9IDQy ‚Äî Ann üëª (@bursinxmurdock) November 22, 2025 Cox was nominated for Best Performance alongside two other Expedition 33 actors, including Ben Starr and Jennifer English. Erika Ishii was nominated for Ghost of Yotei, Konatsu Kato for Silent Hill f, and Troy Baker for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Kohl's promotes interim CEO and 30-year retail veteran Michael J. Bender to be its permanent chief
New Witcher Actor Liam Hemsworth "Holds Up Pretty Well" Compared To Henry Cavill, Game Actor Says
description: Netflix's The Witcher series made a drastic change for its latest season, with The Hunger Games actor Liam Hemsworth stepping in to replace Henry Cavill in the lead role of Geralt. Doug Cockle, who voiced Geralt in the video games, has reacted to the change, saying Hemsworth has done a "fantastic" job taking over for Cavill and has made the role his own. "I loved Henry. He was a fantastic Witcher, Geralt, specifically, so I was sad to see him go, but I have watched the newest season, and I think Liam holds up pretty well," Cockle told GamesRadar. "He's different. He's made it his own character, and that's what he should have done as an actor, and I think he's done a fantastic job." Cavill announced in 2022 that he was leaving The Witcher, and this shocked and dismayed fans of the fantasy show. There was an online petition that gathered hundreds of thousands of signatures asking for Cavill to come back. It was around this time that Cavill announced that he would come back to play Superman again, but that didn't materialize. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Steam's Hottest Game Right Now Is A Free-To-Play Wuxia Sim
description: Embark Studios' mega-popular extraction shooter Arc Raiders has some competition on Steam's most-played game chart, as there's a newcomer on the list: the free-to-play, open-world Wuxia fighter Where Winds Meet. Where Winds Meet is the debut title from Chinese developer Everstone Studio. Set during ancient China's Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period (about 907 to 979 AD), the game is this fantastical amalgam of MMO, action-adventure, and RPG mechanics that seamlessly blends into an open-world environment you can play either in solo or multiplayer modes. There are epic sword fights with flashy combos, Tai Chi moves to basically force-throw animals and enemies, and bosses that rival a From Software game in size and difficulty. Not to mention the wealth of content in the first two regions--Kaifeng and Qinghe--that easily contain hundreds of hours of stuff to do, secrets to find, puzzles to solve, and baddies to beat up. The best part is it's all totally free. Almost everything you experience in Where Winds Meet is free to play. There are premium currencies to buy, a battle pass to purchase and upgrade, clothes and accessories to fill your (digital) wardrobe with--you know, "free-to-play" stuff. However, the action of the game--the bosses, the weapons, the main and side objectives, the minigames, etc.--doesn't cost you anything to play. That's true of future content as well. Since the game's Chinese servers get new features before the global ones do, players on those servers have shared what's coming to the game in upcoming updates, like new regions to explore and weapons to fight with. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Steam Machine Price: Valve May Have Just Given The Best Clue Yet
description: Valve will not say what the Steam Machine's price is just yet, and in this information vacuum, people are offering all kinds of different theories and guesses as to what the six-inch cube-like system may cost. Now, Valve has yet again commented on the pricing question, providing potentially the best clue yet, while also saying the company cannot or will not disclose pricing yet due to "a lot of external things." Speaking to Skill Up--which is co-hosted by GameSpot's Lucy James--Valve software engineer Pierre-Loup Griffais said people can expect the price of the Steam Machine to be close to what it might cost to build a PC with "basically the same level of performance." "I think that if you build a PC from parts and get to basically the same level of performance, that's the general price window that we aim to be at," he said, as reported by IGN. "Ideally we'd be pretty competitive with that and have a pretty good deal, but we're working on refining that as we speak. Right now is just a hard time to have a really good idea of what the price is going to be because there's a lot of different things‚Ä¶ a lot of external things." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Udo Kier Dies At 81, With Kojima Honoring The Red Alert Icon And OD Actor
description: Legendary German actor Udo Kier has died at the age of 81. The news was confirmed by Kier's partner Delbert McBride via Variety. With hundreds of film and TV credits spanning decades, Kier rose to fame in horror films like Mark of the Devil, Flesh for Frankenstein, and Blood for Dracula in the '70s. His breakthrough Hollywood role came in 1991's My Own Private Idaho, and he'd go on to appear in Ace Ventura: Pet Detective, Johnny Mnemonic, Armageddon, and Madonna music videos. In recent years, Kier was one of the actors set to appear in Hideo Kojima's upcoming horror game OD. Game director Hideo Kojima wrote online that new scenes featuring the actor were scheduled to be filmed in 2026, and that he'd kept in touch with him regularly. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Complete Calvin And Hobbes Comic Box Set Is 60% Off At Amazon For Black Friday
description: The Complete Calvin and Hobbes Box Set (Hardcover) $86.15 (was $225) with coupon See at Amazon One of the best comic strips of all time is on sale for an excellent price during Amazon's Black Friday sale. While supplies last--and this deal often sells out during major sales events--The Complete Calvin and Hobbes hardcover box set is available for only $86.15 (was $225). Amazon offered this deal in its early Black Friday sale earlier this month, so if you missed out then, you have another opportunity to add this incredible box set to your bookshelf. To get the full discount, you need to click the coupon box on the store page to save an extra $43.07 at checkout. This beautiful slipcased collection comes with three hardcover books with 1,440 pages of Bill Watterson's iconic comic strip. The Complete Calvin and Hobbes only ever drops this low during big sales like Black Friday and Prime Day. Amazon's deal is so good that the premium hardcover edition is actually cheaper than the paperback version right now. That said, the $91 paperback box set is eligible for Amazon's Buy Two, Get One Free Book Sale this week. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Persona 3 Reload Switch 2 Edition Is Down To $40 For Black Friday
description: Persona 3 Reload (Switch 2) $40 (was $60) See at Amazon If you've picked up a Switch 2 console recently and you're looking to grab a game that'll keep you entertained for nearly 100 hours, Persona 3 Reload comes highly recommended, and it's on sale at Amazon for $40 (was $60) thanks to the retailer's Black Friday event. If you don't own a Switch 2, you can also grab the game on PS5, PS4, and Xbox Series X, but like many of the other video game deals in Amazon's event, these Persona 3 Reload discounts could run out fast, so don't wait--it could be Dark Hour on these deals before you know it. Persona 3 Reload (Switch 2) $40 (was $60) Persona 3 Reload is a full-scale remake of the 2006 classic, introducing new characters, expanded storylines, an all-new voice cast, and a re-recorded soundtrack. The game also features quality-of-life improvements and a redesigned interface that refines the experience while preserving the heart of the cult-classic PS2 original. Note that the Switch 2 version of the game comes on a Game Key-Card, which means none of the game data is included on the cart. Instead, inserting the physical game into your system unlocks the digital version, which you must download to your console before you can start playing. Expect Persona 3 Reload to take up about 25GB on your Switch 2's internal storage or SD card. It's also worth pointing out is that the Episode Aigis DLC expansion is available a separate $35 purchase on the Switch 2 eShop. Episode Aegis adds roughly 30 hours of new story content that takes place after the base game's ending, along with new costumes and music. See at Amazon While Persona 3 Reload came to Switch 2 just a few months ago, it originally launched on PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, and PC back in early 2024. The physical PlayStation and Xbox versions also happen to be on sale at Amazon, and at much lower prices than the Switch 2 version. You can check out all the Persona 3 Reload Black Friday deals below. All Persona 3 Reload Black Friday Deals Switch 2 -- $40 ($60) PS5 -- $18 ($70) PS4 -- $20 ($70) Xbox Series X -- $25 ($35.16) Persona 3 Reload is just one of several Atlus-published RPGs on sale at Amazon during Black Friday. You can also grab Persona 5 Royal on Switch, Metaphor ReFantazio, Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance Edition, and the recently released Raidou Remastered: the Mystery of the Soulless Army. Check out all the Atlus RPG deals at Amazon. And make sure to check out GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub throughout the rest of the month for more price cuts on video games, Blu-rays, board games, and beyond. Continue Reading at GameSpot
